title_full:
EDDIE MARCON

              —
              Yahho no Potori
            
              (A Colourful Storm)
label: A Colourful Storm
description:
A Colourful Storm unearth this killer 2009 album from beloved Japanese acid folk band Eddie Marcon, bringing it to vinyl for the first time. It's softly-spoken, delicate and frayed at the edges - completely essential listening if ur into Ai Aso, Tenniscoats or Maher Shalal Hash Baz.

We first came across Eddie Marcon way back in '05, when the band welded together two of their earliest CDRs into the (pre Longform Editions) Preservation-released 'Shining on Graveposts'. It took us completely by surprise... more

title_full:
Memotone

              —
              Fever of the World
            
              (Soda Gong)
label: Soda Gong
description:
An ascendant Memotone in superb 4th world-building form, inflected with the gorgeously rendered Jazz forms seeping into typically asymmetric dub noise, modal, and ambient concrète elements that also made his turns for TTT and Sähkö so widely beloved. Proper soft-landing gear, tipped if you’re into Arve Henriksen, ECM, Flanger, Conjoint.

The Bristolian multi-instrumentalist terraformer’s music is ideal for the album format, as with his ace ‘Tollard’ for TTT in ’23, here taking the wider... more

title_full:
Mermaid Chunky

              —
              slif slaf slof
            
              (DFA Records)
label: DFA Records
description:
It had to happen eventually, right? British duo Mermaid Chunky cross medieval folk music with grotty electro-punk and synth-y cabaret sounds and cod reggae on 'slif slaf slof', sounding utterly out on their own.

You've got to respect Freya Tate and Moina Moin's determination here. On the opening track 'céilí', a loosely familiar recorder phrase - no doubt referencing the titular Celtic dance - is transformed into a chant and then a galloping, Björk-like hybrid dance track that disassembles and... more

title_full:
Abner Jay

              —
              True Story Of...
            
              (MISSISSIPPI / Mississippi Records)
label: MISSISSIPPI / Mississippi Records
description: "Abner jay, the first of the original Black musicians. The only electric six string banjo you'll ever hear. Abner says the originals are dead, and he is half dead. For forty two years Abner has been playing banjo, drums, harmonica and singing all at the same time. Born in South GA, when Abner was born his pa kept the birth records on the side of the house, the house burned down, the birth records were destroyed, and Abner hasn't been able to find out just how old he is. Abner is now enjoying his... more

label: FAITICHE
description:
Never one to be second guessed, Jan Jelinek returns with a stunning album of text-to-speech recitals of scam emails set to server-room ambient computer music, something like Sam Kidel meets Nozomu Matsumoto at Florian Hecker’s lab.

Conceived originally as a radio work for Südwestrundfunk, ’Social Engineering’ frames thirteen text fragments from “so-call phishing emails” in a playful example of Jan Jelinek’s perspective on the modern world and technology thru the prism of... more
